Better web typography for a better web

31 Jul 2017 by Matej Latin — Typography, Web-design

A book about web typography, based on a course loved by web designers and web developers.

I launched an email course called Better Web Type on 14 February this year. It introduces the topic of typography to people who actually design and build websites—web designers and web developers. Split into 10 daily lessons, it covers topics like rhythm in web typography, how to use modular scales, how to combine typefaces and similar. It was featured in CSS-tricks, as a cover feature in the Net magazine, in the Web Designer magazine, as well as sites like Codrops and Smashing Magazine. The course is highly-rated with an average of 4.7 out of 5 after more than 700 reviews.

The students that went through the course loved it so much that they started asking for a book. Writing a book on the same topic was always on my roadmap but the high demand turned it into my top priority. The book was released as an eBook on July 31 and is available to order on the Better Web Type website. A paperback version will follow shortly.
